website_summaries.verdict: Recommended for heavy duty work, this rotary hammer performs extremely well under varying conditions. Easy to store and hang when not in use.
pros: Brushless motor provides extended run-time and durability
Active Vibration Control feature significantly reduces vibration
Delivers corded rotary hammer-like performance on batteries
cons: Batteries need to be purchased separately

website_summaries.verdict: A commercial-grade tool with immense power. Robust, reliable performance for the professional contractor.
pros: A compact and competitively priced high-performance cordless with brushless motor for extended run time
Clutch prevents injury if bit jams
cons: None, but if you don’t already have a compatible 20V battery and charger, that will add around $100 to your cost

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I've bought in years (and I buy a lot)
customer_reviews.text: After drilling the first hole (2" deep with 3/16 bit), which only took about 3 seconds into brick for a tapcon, I knew this thing was worth every penny! I only had regular dewalt hammer drill before this and the difference is night and day especially when drilling into something as hard as brick. I used my 6AH flexvolt battery to start and it lasted for so long that i have no clue how many holes i drilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: SOE CONTRACTING

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The most rugged tool by dewalt by far. I've used mine for 4 months now and absolutely love it! It takes a beating and more. Works great for the glazier trade. also bought another for my dad for his birthday and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MARPAT909

customer_reviews.title: Almost too good
customer_reviews.text: This thing drilled through my block wall like a hot knife on butter. I went too fast and ended up knocking out more stucco than I had anticipated. I should have drilled from the stucco side in, but I wasn't expecting how fast this rotary drill would work. I was expecting the results of a normal hammer drill and didn't realize the differences between a normal hammer drill and a rotary hammer drill.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool, but chiseling is ify...
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, smooth operating, and fast. Will certainly drain a flexvolt 60v battery, but that's to be expected sinking holes in a concrete slab. Only feature with this tool I dislike is the lack of power in the chipping hammer/jackhammer setting. Even after drilling out the perimeter and inside with the drill bits this thing still takes forever to chisel away concrete. Understandably, it's battery powered so that's somewhat to be expected...it's still a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Green

customer_reviews.title: it makes easy work of old concrete which is the litmus test ...
customer_reviews.text: this bubba is a beast , and it does in fact accept the 60 volt battery , it makes easy work of old concrete which is the litmus test for a hammer drill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Dewalt Product
customer_reviews.text: I love the new brushless model. I had the previous 20v model and lasted me three years of heavy use. When that one got tired and worn out I needed a replacement so I got this one. I love all their brushless tools. This new brushless model has all the same features as the older one with more improvements. I like that it has a belt clip on for working off a ladder. The 20v hammerdrill is nice for quick jobs, saves time running cords around and finding the next nearest outlet. Will definitely buy this again when the time comes and I recommend this hammerdrill to anyone looking for a small compact, yet powerful drill
customer_reviews.author: Jon H

customer_reviews.title: Best Cordless Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with two 4 amp hour batteries. I had to drill about 64 holes into steel reinforced concrete. I was able to drill all the holes without even charging one battery which I found impressive. More importantly, this Dewalt was easy to use, not very heavy and did not cause fatigue. I was drilling on walls, and some of them were over my head. I love Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W.

customer_reviews.title: Use it to drive 12” spikes and ground rods.
customer_reviews.text: Use it to drive 12” spikes and ground rods. Couple with a Dewalt 60v battery it last multiple days of extreme use
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Product Description
customer_reviews.text: This item is listed as: "DEWALT 20V MAX SDS Rotary Hammer Drill". "Max SDS" is not part of the description on the tool or the box, and an SDS Max bit absolutely will not fit this tool. Irritating to have to return this tool, more irritating to have to spend $4 to do it.
customer_reviews.author: cappy102

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!  Extremely useful!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this drill to drive ground rods in instead of using my corded SDS max drill. I have corded sds plus and max drills but rarely have access to power to use them. This drill was one of the best purchases I've ever made. It's so much quieter and more powerful than a basic Dewalt 20v hammer drill. I also recommend using a 60v battery which works with 20v Dewalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg A. Kulback

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife through butter
customer_reviews.text: We needed to replace a railing that had been concrete nailed to our back steps, and a wrought iron railing that rusted away on our front steps. The back step is old concrete (house built in the 1900's), and the 1/4" bit went through like we were drilling soft wood. Front steps were flagstone and concrete, both drilled just as easy! Now we're looking for other projects we've held off on/never considered because drilling concrete and stone seemed like such a pain. I purchased a pack of chisels for it too, and look forward to using it as a small jackhammer. The active vibration dampening system works amazingly well too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: ... called upon to fix almost anything This drill is fantastic. I have already used it several times and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am employed in a school as a mechanic- carpenter and can be called upon to fix almost anything This drill is fantastic. I have already used it several times and so far drilling holes up to 1" in diameter it has worked great even into re-enforced concrete
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to the 20V lineup.
customer_reviews.text: Make no mistake, a very good tool. The only hitch it that the operator has to ramp up the rpm and apply force to get it to hammer. Plenty of power once the hammering starts, 1/2” anchors into poured concrete are no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ervin

customer_reviews.title: A beast.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I bought one flex volt battery and it ran for hours. Works better than my Bosch corded one. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: 10ish Uses and Broke
customer_reviews.text: Worked great while it lasted, super easy hole drilling. Used it to break out about 6'x4" of cut concrete, last foot or so started feeling weaker, now wont do anything but click. Almost $300 and I expect alot more from this tool. Now have to make the 2hr trip to the service center and hope they treat me alright. yay.
customer_reviews.author: tem

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: This is amazingly strong for a battery operated device. We have done a lot of work with it and it’s still runs great! It replaced the big heavy corded model ( another brand known for xxhd ability) that i only trusted! I have used them for thirty years... and never thought this kind of power could be so light and on a battery!
customer_reviews.author: J. Holley

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I own another Dewalt. It was worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I bought this. The concrete project was taking entirely too long. I had a small drill with a standard chuck. The bit kept loosening the chuck and I would have to stop and tighten the chuck to get the bit out. The SDS system works great. And after switching to this drill my concrete job was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Junge

customer_reviews.title: Drills 1" holes through concrete
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous buying this as a 1" bit is at the top of the spectrum for what an SDS+ will run and was trying to avoid the added cost of buying an SDS max. It put a 1" diameter hole through block wall in under a minute. Very happy with the purchase and this will be replacing my oldschool, corded hammerdrill.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Think about
customer_reviews.text: I always love dewalt brand. I see the commercial and it shows can drawl 60 holes before battery is dying. I also bought a package battery alone with it. The battery is dying before 60 holes
customer_reviews.author: zhang lu

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the corded version!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine (de Walt xr 20 volt sds) daily at work. It take less effort, more compact for tight spaces than the corded version( that I’ve burnt 2 up in the last 15yrs.) so we’ll see how long this lasts. So far 8 months & still runs strong like new. When ever this burns out, I will get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hell yeah !!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah ! Thia thing is AWESOME. Drills fast and has just as much power as the $700 company Hilti that's on my van. The vacuum attachment works great too. Can drill all day and not drop a crumb of dust if you empty it every few holes.
customer_reviews.author: unkown

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend. This tool is a beast for drilling holes . It can stand toe to toe with electrical drills
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: came in working order, I knew from previous experience that this hammer drill is very good, powerful and with little vibrations to hand.
customer_reviews.author: Iceman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: This dude is a beast! Hammer drill for relief cuts, a you can pretty much jackhammer a medium sized concrete patch - I've done a slab drain extension with it. Chipping is ridiculously efficient, too! Torque leaves a bit to be desired for 5/8" drill bit & up & it requires 4ah & up for efficiency - I cant wait to try a 60v flex on 'er.... Overall; This tool is a champ! 👍🥇👍
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it ! You know you want one
customer_reviews.text: I was not disappointed. So much easier than dragging out cords to plug in
customer_reviews.author: Valued Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Iron Fist in a Velvet Glove
customer_reviews.text: This top rated rotary hammer is a beast - furthermore, it is comfortable and lightweight. SDS+ chucking is awesome and easy - and cordless. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Capeder

customer_reviews.title: Best tool ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my best investments it works great on foundations, brick, center block it's worth every penny not to find extension cords and power.
customer_reviews.author: Ron...

customer_reviews.title: Another Dewalt slam dunk
customer_reviews.text: This thing drills into concrete like it is hot butter. If you already have other Dewalt tools, this will quickly become one of your favorites in the collection. Nearly everything they make is rock solid and this is no exception. Battery life with a 6ah flexvolt is very good. Fantastic rotary hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Miller

customer_reviews.title: This tool is a beast
customer_reviews.text: Amazing is all I can say about this tool. I was able to complete all my home improvement works with this tool. It actually drilled through reinforced concrete walls with ease, in fact effortless. I actually used my DeWALT 20V max flex volt pack on it, and it worked like a monster. This tool was more than worth the price as compared to all the others on the market.
customer_reviews.author: stephen mathison

customer_reviews.title: broke after 90 days
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 90 days ago and it quit working and it can not be returned and has no warranty
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: this tools makes you want to drill more concrete. its drill really nice with ease. beats a hammer drill by a million
customer_reviews.author: ZaT

customer_reviews.title: Power to spare
customer_reviews.text: This is a hog, punched a hole in a retaining wall for some conduit in about 2 minutes flat. I would recommend getting one of the bigger batteries to run it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great, powerful hammer drill that’s not too heavy. I do wish it accepted standard bits in addition to SDS bits.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Small

customer_reviews.title: ROI was near instant. Make every job easier and much faster
customer_reviews.text: I was an idiot for not purchasing this years ago. Paid for its self on it first project. Speeds up everything , make the job so much easier with much less effort. worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS AN ANIMAL! WE INSTALL CONVEYORS FOR A LIVING AND DECIDED TO TRY CORDLESS FOR CONVENIENCE. SO FAR IT'S A BEAST!

customer_reviews.title: Thanke
customer_reviews.text: that you worked really well right now it was for the money and I recommend it to anybody that needs that Need That drill

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great item works very well nice and light strong and durable love this tool thank you
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This tool works great, easy to drill with one hand. drilled though 12 inch concrete wall under 2 min closer to 1 min 7/8 hole. and the bits seem to alone will pay for this tool because of the long life unlike regular bits.
customer_reviews.author: Andy's Fix it dot com

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my new drill
customer_reviews.text: This drill with a new sds bit goes through concrete like a knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: Nastytotems

customer_reviews.title: Got my moneys worth
customer_reviews.text: Battery operated light white and easy to use use it for our drilling anchor holes
customer_reviews.author: michael sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool.
customer_reviews.text: Being tethered to a cord sux. This drill works perfect

customer_reviews.title: I have doubts about the quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the secound Dewalt DCH273B hammer drill that I buy in one year. The first got stuck after beeing used for some time. This one however wad used for few days and suddenly became stuck. But good thing is that the service at Dewalt is 100% and you will get a replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact sds+
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you etch your name on it lol. And get good sds bits. Otherwise this thing will destroy them
customer_reviews.author: cameron vath

customer_reviews.title: Wrong description!
customer_reviews.text: This is not an SDS Max this is the smaller SDS! Shouldn’t be written up as max SDS!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Faucette

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Wow doesn't describe. Goes through granite like butter with 1/4" bit..... awesome drill. so good I bought another.

customer_reviews.title: Very bad
customer_reviews.text: I did buy a new product and received an old Product

customer_reviews.title: Love this buy.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product by dewalt very impressed with this one! Thank you dewalt.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful,
customer_reviews.text: This rotary hammer is compact and powerful, use it to drill into concrete to install floor stops and floor mounted track systems
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cozzens

customer_reviews.title: Luxury item but worth it, if you dont use it will just last longer.
customer_reviews.text: Sold my corded version to this thing, never knew how little I needed electricity to work.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This fits the job for which I need it for, setting anchors and tapcons.

customer_reviews.title: Its useless
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this product for the first time yesterday 1/31/20 and after just scraping 5to6 tiles it just shut down on me no reaction no power whatsoever

customer_reviews.title: Swwet
customer_reviews.text: Had problems getting it long story but at the end of the day amazon and cpo tools are amazing with with all the problems they would had have me the vacuum for it for free but I'm happy i got it

customer_reviews.title: It is a keeper!!!
customer_reviews.text: Using this for work. Very pleased with the product. Works well.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great can't believe it works as good for cordless

customer_reviews.title: Broke down within a month of use.
customer_reviews.text: The chipping feature stopped working within a month of use. Disappointed by this product. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Virna

customer_reviews.title: The drill worked excellent except for when it started bouncing and binding up ...
customer_reviews.text: The drill worked excellent except for when it started bouncing and binding up it would stop running. I would release the trigger and restart it. I don’t know if it’s a flaw or or a safety issue. Does anyone else have that problem .
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Tinney

customer_reviews.title: You wont believe it runs on batteries
customer_reviews.text: This hammer drill works as good as my corded on and fits in tight spaces
customer_reviews.author: Richard E.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is already the 2nd one I got, I like the power this has
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Tools arent supposed to be babied, they should be ...
customer_reviews.text: Tools arent supposed to be babied, they should be Used And Abused, im an Dewalt all the way guy, Worth the money if you are in construction, Plus cordless, Wow about time they make this, got tired of grinding concrete and smelling that concrete!!! Lungs are more important then $300 bucks of a tool.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! Having it is such a blessing. As a commercial electrician, I find myself having to mount conduit, unistrut, disconnects, and panel boxes to concrete. This tool makes these tasks much more simpler. It plows away through concrete as if it was butter. It is well built. It is powerful and very fun to use. I am highly satisfied that I made this purchase. I paid $285. For me, it was a little expensive, but a great investment because it makes my job easier. I would recommend this tool to anyone that wants to invest in a rotary hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for battery powered hammer drill when power is not available.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician and I use it for drilling holes in concrete, block, and tile. It works very good.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus Kubisiak

customer_reviews.title: Convenience
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when you don't want to get a cord out for a few holes to drill. Runs for a pretty long time with the 5A batteries and hits just as hard as the corded drill.
customer_reviews.author: DPM

customer_reviews.title: Powerful tool
customer_reviews.text: Is small size for the same power than a corded bosh one that I have one . Is very helpfully for small job .

customer_reviews.title: Like butter
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. Use it on regular basis without a hiccup

customer_reviews.title: Despite all the great reviews I don't find that this has much power
customer_reviews.text: Despite all the great reviews I don't find that this has much power. Other reviewers said they demoed entire concrete paths. As a professional, I can honestly call the BS card on that claim. It would take forever to use this on anything other than drilling holes, in comparison to any normal jackhammer. the other thing is it is fine for concrete drills but I have found it doesn't work so well with big diamond coated hole saws. I am going to try a DCH481 and see if that is any better (it is twice the price)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer2

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful for a battery operated SDS drill. I haven't pulled out my AC SDS since I've bought this. I get asked about this tool at almost every job site, contractors asking if they can try it out and where I bought it from
customer_reviews.author: Moe Faraj

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best tool ever. I'm an electrician working in a commercial building and I use it almost everyday. I highly recommended. However I did purchase the bigger batteries for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V.

customer_reviews.title: SDS Power
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a battery hammer drill for many years. I wish I would have switched years ago. This SDS is very powerful. Chews through masonry like cutting through butter. Almost no effort at all and nowhere near as loud. It is on the heavy side in comparison but I will never use a regular hammer drill ever again.
customer_reviews.author: GFORCETECH

customer_reviews.title: After 1. 5 years of moderate use, the ...
customer_reviews.text: After 1.5 years of moderate use, the hammer drill stopped working; now it only drills regularly, but cannot drill into concrete. Up until that, it performed amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have a hobby...
customer_reviews.text: I was drilling into the brick side of my house to attach shutters to my house with an ordinary 18v cordless drill. Each hole took 5mn and a lot of swearing - no fun when trying to do second floor windows. This drill takes 15 seconds to do what the previous did in 5mn. Pricey, but worth it. The only problem is, this tool lets me do a lot of other things around the house myself instead of hiring someone....so I've just bought a hundred more chores. Gotta have a hobby I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer #RX7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 1/4 and 3/8. Like sticking your finger in peanutbutter.
customer_reviews.author: Hilario from San Diego

customer_reviews.title: I love not having to pull out a generator all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Really wish I had bought this years ago. I love not having to pull out a generator all the time. I originally thought I would only use it for form fasteners, but now I'm using it to drill dowel holes. I think it hits as hard as any SDS plus that I have used. I also bought the 6 AMP Hour batteries to go along with it, and that really makes it worth while.

product_meta.title: DEWALT 20V MAX SDS Rotary Hammer Drill, Tool Only (DCH273B)
product_meta.description: Style:Rotary hammerThe DEWALT DCH273B 20v Max Brushless SDS Rotary Hammer Bare tool features a DEWALT brushless motor for extended runtime and durability. It also offers Active Vibration Control which significantly reduces vibration and increases user comfort and productivity; a Perform and Protect feature from DEWALT. This rotary hammer gives 2.1 Joules impact energy which provides corded power without the cord. It also has a retractable utility hook for convenient hanging and storage. This is a bare tool item - battery sold separately. Includes: 360 Degree Side Handle, Depth Rod, Retractable Utility Hook.
feature_bullets: Brushless motor for extended runtime and durability
Active Vibration Control which significantly reduces vibration
